reviews.text: I have enjoyed delicious traditional vietnamese quisine in here. It's like the course foods for wedding ceremony in Vietnam. This restaurant is located in center area, has spacious area, kind staffs, delicious meals. I recommend this restaurant to you.
Too local for me, however, my Vietnamese friends enjoyed the foods

Located in a local neighborhood of Saigon, its price is weirdly expensive. You can get way better food with way better location, atmosphere, and service at fancier restaurants at the same price, for example, Hoang Yen Restaurant or Ngoc Suong. It's not the absolute worst restaurant, but I wouldn't recommend anyone here because of service and food price/quality - opt for the ones mentioned above or its neighbor, Huong Cau (not the best either but not the worst).

This restaurant is a typical Vietnamese restaurant that sells basic Vietnamese foods, I don't know how to describe it but it doesn't specialize in anything except for "m√≥n ƒÉn nh·∫≠u ki·ªÉu Vi·ªát Nam." Our server was probably a manager there who was quite pushy - she recommended expensive dishes to us on purpose, for example, recommending us a hotpot that doubles the price of all the other ones.

Continuing with that, dish prices are ridiculously considering its location and most guests that this place were targeted for. We spent around 2,000k vnd (~$80) for 6 people, and it might not sound like a lot - but considering the restaurant‚Äôs location, quality, and targeted customers - very expensive. One dish I would not recommend is the b√≤ l√∫c l·∫Øc. They claimed to use Australian beef - named ‚ÄúHokubee‚Äù - apparently, but it was very fatty and not in good quality. This dish was almost 400k (~ $15), and I was concerned of how expensive it was because you can get a b√≤ l√∫c l·∫Øc dish at a way fancier restaurant for half the price - i‚Äôm talking about Ho√†ng Y·∫øn Restaurant. The manager tried to justify for it but honestly, it‚Äôs too expensive. Also some dishes took very very long to come up that we had to cancel it. It was a grilled chicken one, i think, and after waiting for 20 minutes, we asked them and they said that they were grilling it and will come up soon. 15 minutes later, nothing. So they lied, and we canceled it.

Overall, the food isn‚Äôt terrible, except for the b√≤ l√∫c l·∫Øc, but very expensive with unprofessional service. I‚Äôve dined here multiple times in the past and honestly would not come back again now.

reviews.text: First off, you are paying for the location and the setting here. It's almost opposite the palace and has a huge menu spanning over 40 pages, how much choice is too much? It's great if you're in a group, maybe not so good as a solo traveler. I got combo number 2, a Vietnamese coffee and crab meat soup for 304,000k. I enjoyed every single one of the dishes, 5 different appetisers and they all tasted good. The crab meat soup was thick like "geng Áæπ" in Chinese cuisine and was loaded with crab. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this restaurant, the food was good and I liked the setting.

What a gorgeous restaurant, more like a big family restaurant. The aunties are cooking next to the diners, such a wholesome sight to see. Whilst devouring the array of amazing fresh Vietnamese dishes I am in awe of the architecture and maintenance of the space. I would definitely recommend this gem to my friends and family!

If you get here early, about 17:30, you can get a table right at the front on the ground floor.
I went twice during my stay and must say that each and every dish was wonderfully delicious,  authentic,  well presented, and value for money considering the location and ambience.
The beers are a little expensive compared to most places,  but the standard of the delicious food and the setting make it well worthwhile. The giveaway is that locals love this spot,  and if I am ever in Saigon again I will most definitely go again.

My only gripe is the price. The value is not there. Not that is bad, but I expect more impressive food for the price. But I would come back though.

Everything we ordered hit the table like a flavor bomb‚Äîbold, amazing flavors in every bite! The Vietnamese prawn pancakes were the only miss here (not recommended), too bland compared to everything else we tried. Still, we were too hooked on the standout dishes to mind much.

Our waitress was a champ, patient and on point with our big group. The jasmine IPA from a local brewery was sensational. Highly recommend this spot! üòçüëåüèº

reviews.text: Went for lunch on a weekday. It was busy, but I was seated quickly. The staff are helpful. It's a restaurant that caters to tourists, with tourist prices and strong aircon. The menu has pictures and English descriptions. I ordered the special set. It arrived quickly. The meat pieces were tasty. The spring roll was thick and crunchy, but not particularly flavorful. The noodles with the sauce were very good. The leftover sauce was great, I drank it all. Paid with a card.

Today, I visited Qu√°n Ngon - B√∫n Ch·∫£ H√† N·ªôi with friends. This humble eatery is tucked away in a side street near the entrance to Ph·ªë ƒêi B·ªô B√πi Vi·ªán. Despite its central location in a popular tourist hotspot, the prices are very reasonable. For a special menu, which included a spring roll, the cost was under 100,000 VND. I also ordered some extra meat.

The restaurant offers air-conditioned seating, making it a comfortable escape from the heat. The food was delicious‚Äîthe meat was perfectly grilled, and the broth was rich and flavorful. Overall, a great dining experience!

I have always wanted to sample more bun cha dishes in HCMC after tasting a good one in my recent travel. A quick search online led me to this place with what seemed to be a solid rating. The menu here was simple as they only offer bun cha in few variations. I went for the special one which came with a fried spring roll. If you enjoy a lighter and less intense bun cha dipping sauce then this may be up your alley. I thought the sauce was not as rich and strong in flavors compared to the one I tasted few days ago. Nonetheless, it was not devoid of taste by any means and yhat simply meant that one can enjoy more of the dipping sauce since it will be lighter on your palate. The grilled pork were nicely prepared with delicious smoky flavors. The minced pork patties was decent but again, my previous bun cha patties were on another level. The rice noodles were average and the fried spring roll was a hearty addition to your bun cha. Having said all that, I personally felt that the bun cha here was decent albeit lacking the intense flavors which I was looking for.

This is the only restaurant my husband always want to come back every time we are in Vietnam. reviews.text: Great food to be had! It‚Äôs has lovely garden setting as well. You get the authentic feel but with high quality refined food. The menu is dominated by a great selection of vegetable dishes on offer. Highly recommend coming and trying out. The soft shell crab was spot on, the mango salad was excellent as well. Shout out to the fried rice which was a great accompaniment to the salad. The prices were pretty affordable as well for the type of place.

We were craving rice and home cooking after our trip to Bangkok so we decided to give this place a try.

Food is actually pretty good but extremely overpriced for what it is.

Everything was cooked to perfection and seasoned very nicely. The tofu and fried fish were probably my favourites of the night but everything was pretty tasty.

Portion is nice.. Manageable size even for couples. If you come with your family or friends, you can order a few more dishes to share. Generally, the food is not spicy and very delicious.
Salad is a great start, for a lighter food, fried tofu is yummy! Love the soup they recommended us. Was a little worried that it's catfish (usually has a muddy taste, but this doesn't have it). I would recommend the stew pork, too. Reminds me of home (bak kuh teh).
Green mango juice is pretty unique too (taste like balong long drink). I enjoyed my lotus tea!
Great service, too. The servers are very attentive. Every now and then, they will check on us.

Okay, spring rolls are ok, served hot and crispy, the fish sauce is sweet, not salty like the Quang region, probably adjusted to suit the taste of the South, easy to sell. The banh xeo was cold and chewy, not freshly made, the banh beo was also cold, who in the world would sell cold banh beo to customers like that.
Service:
Staff attitude, I went to eat with colleagues and everyone felt the attitude of the staff when my table asked for more vegetables and fish sauce. While there were 3 of us, ordered 3 spring rolls, but only 1 plate of vegetables, 2 bowls of fish sauce, and the small bowl of fish sauce was the size of a banh beo bowl. From the moment I asked for more, the staff brought the food out and put it on the table very rudely, for example, if I was too sensitive, I wouldn't say anything, but everyone at the table felt his attitude.

reviews.text: Proper Vietnamese home cooking. I ordered the thit heo kho tieu (braised pork with pepper)  and the simmered chicken with ginger. Could not fault either of them. The pork was meltingly tender, savory and slightly sweet, with a robust flavor profile due to the fish sauce, sugar, and black pepper. It has a warm spiciness that adds depth without overwhelming the palate. The chicken fell off the bone served with an awesome smelling gingery broth which flavoured the rice perfectly. Could not ask for a better meal. 2 dishes, rice and a drink, 180k
Had lunch with my family. The taste of the food is OK but when I have my dish, I saw a rubber band in the food. Lost my appetite üòí

As soon as I saw the restaurant, I was skeptical. The atmosphere was too "cute" by half and therefore, I was worried about the "lowest common denominator" effect that touristy places sometimes have (serve the bare minimum because tourist don't know better). And I was right.

We had to peel the wait staff from their phones for every little request. The food was OK, but when I asked for more noodles for my mi quang (a common request in any restaurant that it is usually on the menu as an a la carte add-on and my bowl was sorely lacking in noodles), we were given a long winded excuse (in Vietnamese to my Viet wife) about how that was impossible to get extra noodles unless I ordered an entire additional mi quang. This is a common 'screw the tourist' play, but I've been here 18 years and it pissed me right off.

The first picture is my bowl of mi quang AFTER my wife gave me all her noodles (she took all my chicken (second picture)).

So in summation, a shame as it could be a "cute" place to go or take friends, the flavor was fine, but the staff and the 'nickel and dime' routine was off-putting. Won;t go back.

reviews.text: This restaurant serves traditional Northern Vietnamese Food! Being a tourist, I was quite impressed with the huge paintings on the wall and the decoration is very lovely, not forgetting to mention the server is friendly too! Food portion was huge and suitable for family or team dining. Presentation is in traditional way and tasted as good as per our expectation. Good dining experience and walking distance to the centre of District1 at HCMC.

We enjoyed our meal here. The place gives us an authentic vibes of Northern Vietnam. Though it‚Äôs a bit costly, the foods are worth the money. Every dish we had was really tasty and the portions are big enough to share. The ‚Äúcha ca la vong‚Äù was so good and the tofu in scallion oil is highly recommended. The staff are attentive, accommodating and polite. The best part is the ambiance and comfortable seats. The menu also offers a wide variety of sumptuous local Northern cuisines to choose from. The drinks menu includes healthy options. The only reason for 4 stars is hoping to have smaller portions for affordable options later on. We‚Äôll be back!

Ann Quan in Ho Chi Minh City is a hidden gem that brings together refined Vietnamese flavors with an elegant, modern atmosphere. From the moment we arrived, we were greeted with warm hospitality and attentive service, making us feel truly welcome. The ambiance is both cozy and sophisticated, with beautiful decor that highlights Vietnam's rich culture in a contemporary way. A must-visit for anyone in Ho Chi Minh City looking to enjoy authentic Northern Vietnamese food with a modern twist in a delightful setting. Highly recommended for both locals and tourists!

reviews.text:
This is a small and charming restaurant serving delightful Vietnamese food. The setting and ambience are pleasant and inviting.

The coconut fried rice has a lovely hint of coconut flavor and is well-prepared. The beef skewers are soft and tender, while the crispy pork pairs nicely with the flavorful sesame sauce. However, the pork knuckle was rather ordinary and did not meet expectations.

Overall, the presentation of the dishes and the restaurant‚Äôs setting are very nice. It‚Äôs a good spot for a casual and satisfying meal.

This was the best tasting food that I've eaten at during my trip to Vietnam.  I liked it so much that I came back 2 other times, and brought a friend the second time.  My first experience at this place, I ordered the Beef Skewers with Rice Vermicelli and an order Fried Spring Rolls and Pickled Plum Juice.  These were all recommended by my waiter, and I gave everything a 10/10, and the portions were huge and I completely devoured it.  The second time I ordered the recommended Stir-Fried Beef Fillet with Beef Sauce and Vegetable and Salted Lemon Drink and didn't like it as much, as it didn't taste as good and the portion was a lot smaller.  The waiter also forgot the Spring rolls we ordered.  The place seems to have a lot of foreigners (which is often a red flag for me), and it does seem a bit commercial (it is a franchise), so I questioned its authenticity as Vietnamese cuisine.  However, despite all this, I still highly recommend this place as it's still my go-to when I want a full hearty and tasty meal that seems reasonably authentic.  It also seems like a good place to bring a date.

The service was fast. Although poor signal for card payment but the servers were always smiling and polite.

Food was served fast and hot. We love the skewers and pancakes. Really filling to the tummy. The servings were really good for sharing.

The ambiance is very soothing to the mood.

reviews.text:
Li Bai Dimsum Restaurant inside the Sheraton Hotel is a true gem for anyone who loves authentic, high-quality Chinese cuisine. From the moment you step inside, you‚Äôre welcomed by an elegant and relaxing atmosphere that perfectly complements the dining experience.

The dim sum here is outstanding ‚Äî each dish is carefully crafted, beautifully presented, and full of authentic flavors. Whether it was the tender har gow, the crispy spring rolls, or the rich and savory siu mai, every bite was a delight. The menu offers a wide variety, so there's something for everyone to enjoy.

What truly made the experience unforgettable was the exceptional service from our waitress, Ti√™n. She was incredibly welcoming, knowledgeable, and attentive throughout our meal. Ti√™n not only made excellent recommendations from the menu but also took the time to explain each dish and ensure we were completely satisfied. Her warm personality and genuine care for guests elevated our dining experience to another level.

It‚Äôs rare to encounter service that feels both highly professional and sincerely personal, but Ti√™n delivered that perfectly. She made us feel like valued guests rather than just another table.

If you‚Äôre staying at the Sheraton or simply looking for an extraordinary dim sum experience, Li Bai is a must-visit. And if you're lucky enough to have Ti√™n as your server, you're in for an even more memorable meal.

Highly recommended for both the incredible food and truly outstanding service.

reviews.text:
I absolutely love this place! They are very popular and their business is driving to the point where they have four units side by side for their one restaurant on a main street. You can't afford that unless your food and service are excellent! The food is great and the atmosphere is pretty good. But what is the most kindness and hospitality with the owner and staff has bestowed upon me. My family came here to eat the special crab udon noodles soup. After the meal, I was stranded alone and couldn't book a ride because it was raining during rush hours. The owner recognized the distress expression on my face and had one of her waiters drive me back to my hotel. ü•∞
The next day I came back to try a different dish, crab rice noodle soup, which was also very good, the owner, √öt L·ªá, again offered me a ride back to the hotel. But I told her it wasn't necessary because I was actually on my way to somewhere else. But I really appreciate her generosity and hospitality. When she heard that, she had her husband, Qu√¢n, drive me to my next destination. I said it wasn't necessary but insisted on helping me. ü•∞
Their generosity is enough for me to recommend this place. But I recommend this place for everything: the service, food and hospitality!

The restaurant is spacious, the prices are reasonable, the service is quick and polite, the crab noodle soup is okay but the bagel twists have oily smell (it made me feel that cooking oil was reused many times), there is free parking for motorbikes.

A local friend of mine told me about this place. Their main dish is crab noodle soup, must try! I've had this same dish at home in Melbourne Australia (only 1 place makes it). The noodle soup here is more delicious, the fish cakes, the bread dipping and quail eggs all add extra flavour to the dish. The only thing lacking is the crab meat but you expect this when you're only paying $60000 VND($4AUD). The price I paid in Australia was $29 aud(it does have more crabs). The place is packed with locals and I will return to order more. Fantastic!

reviews.text: Excellent local restaurant. Have wanted to come here since seeing it on a travel show ‚ÄòSomeone Feed Phil‚Äô. Happy salad is definitely a must as is the Cajun style shrimps. The fried rice dish with beef was also great but the best was the fried tofu - just superb, couldn‚Äôt get enough of it. We had heard great things about this restaurant and we were so impressed!
After reading that dinner gets super busy with the locals, we decided to have lunch here instead. We would recommend this option as we had our pick of the tables and the food came out really quickly.
We ordered the chef signature dishes of Happy Salad which contained beef, garlic, pineapple, Vietnamese eggplant, kumquat, mint, lemongrass, passionfruit dressing and sesame seeds and the Cajun Shrimps with Garlic Butter Sauce plus also the Mexico Wonton to share.
All the dishes were outstanding, leaving us with satisfied smiles on our faces due to just how delicious they were!
The staff were really friendly in spite of there sometimes being a language barrier on both sides but the menu is in English and Vietnamese so you can point to the dishes you want to order.
This restaurant was without a doubt one of our favourites in Vietnam (and we visited a lot!) so just make sure you visit with an empty stomach!

The chef came out to talk me through the food, he mentioned they didn‚Äôt take credit cards and drove me to the local atm‚Ä¶. He wouldn‚Äôt take any tips after that either. This DIY platter comprises of my top choices for meat: Bo La Lot. reviews.text:
One of the best Pho restaurants I had been so far.

I went here many times and never had any issue. Some of the reviews are very odd and I believe it's roasting from other companys. Some people give 1 star review in total but  say food 5* and Ambiente 5*  and service 1* so how can the total be 1 star then ?

You can see your Pho bowl been freshly made while you take a look through the glass window inside the shop. They also make the noodles fresh which isn't common at restaurants nowadays. The noodles therefore taste very fresh.

It's literally make your own pho. You get the base plus many herbs, vegetables and sauces to combine .

You can also order some drinks if you want I paid 95k for everything you see on the picture . The herbs are complementary.

**TLDR: 2/10 rating. Worst ph·ªü in 6 months while living in Saigon. Maybe everyone else of the many reviews got way better, but what I received was brutal‚Ä¶ especially for ‚Ç´100k**

I had the ‚ÄúC5‚Äù - ‚ÄúPh·ªü Th·ªë ƒê√°‚Äù - beef shank, well done flank, oxtail & beef ribs

‚Äî

Local Vietnamese don‚Äôt use Google reviews much, so this scathing criticism is to help tourists who consider visiting here.

For me, good ph·ªü has good broth and good meat, and this had neither. A first for me eating ph·ªü in Mexico, the US and 6 months here in Vietnam.

- broth lacked character, richness and nuance‚Ä¶ unlike SO many other bowls of ph·ªü here in Saigon, and they‚Äôre all 1/2 the price of this ‚Ç´100k tragedy in a bowl

- meat pieces were chewy and nearly flavorless

PROS:
- Hot stone bowl
- Air-conditioning
- House-made noodles, but the benefit of rice noodles made in-house is far less than with Italian style pasta
- Qu·∫©y - if you want this (breadsticks)

CONS:
- Bland, flavorless broth
- Small portion of chewy, low-quality beef

100% I do **not** recommend.

There‚Äôs TOO much amazing food in Saigon to settle for insipid, no-love, bland ph·ªü.

Affordable price, i came and ask the staff if they accept card for payment but the staff cant speak english, so i need to wait until 1 staff come and talk to me, i think only one staff who can speak english. Order the one with hot stone, so we need to put by ourselves the noodles, meat and other vegetable into the hot stone fill with the soup. Because i not put all of them in one time, the soup not boil enough and my meat not cooked well, lol, so i ask the staff who can speak english to boil again my soup, and voila..they also adding my soup.

The taste really yummy, the meat so tender, the noodles also fresh and they give so many vegetables, the soup is super tasty, love it. The restaurant really crowd, but more guest come with family. The condiment available in the table and the drink (looks like tea) also avail in the table, free charge, free refill. I got trouble with my payment, but thanks for the cashier want to wait until the issued solved. The restroom also clean and provide westafel.

reviews.text: Best steak I've ever had in Vietnam. Came with my dad, and he said it was the best steak in his life, which hurt my feelings a little since I cook steak for him at home in the US. The wine list is extensive and sourced from around the world. I thought the special promo was a great idea because it got us in the door and now we want to stay here.

Overall, a wonderful experience. #yummycertified

I recommend this place for eat beef.

reviews.text:
Family cooking for traditional meal.
If you fancy a lunch or dinner with a taste of Northern Vietnam, then this is one the places of choice. Service quality is casual though always friendly. Meals taste good, I picked the set menu for two, soup is excellent, omelette tasty, pork slices with "m·∫Øm t√¥m" truly nice. Only 3 stars because the place could be cleaner.

Unique northern Vietnamese cuisine. We ordered some exotic food such as silkworm, fake 'dog' meat (it's actually pork) & pig innards.

It actually taste quite special. Unique flavour. I was told that the 'dog' meat is prepared using a type of fermented germ which is usually used for the preparation of real dog meat.

Give it a try for an out of the norm food. I'm sure you will find it interesting.

I was invited here for dinner. Thought the food should taste like authentic in Ha Noi but turned out wrong. The only thing was decent was the soup. Beside that, the fishes that were cooked in the clay pot was reheated so may times it was chewy and sour. The grilled fishes with dill were too much fat on the fish so it tasted like eating pork fat. Sorry that I sounded like I‚Äôm over exaggerated but really nothing in the shop tasted like the original recipes in the northern of Vietnam.

reviews.text: This restaurant was recommended by my Vietnamese friend. As a Filipino, I found some of the dishes pleasantly familiar, which made the experience feel like home. Bui Bistro is a delightful dining destination that truly showcases the richness of Vietnamese cuisine. The variety of dishes on their menu is impressive, offering everything from classic pho to vibrant banh mi and delectable spring rolls. Each dish is crafted with authentic ingredients, ensuring an unforgettable culinary experience.

What sets Bui Bistro apart is not just the food, but also the quick and friendly support from the staff. They are always eager to help, providing recommendations and ensuring that each guest feels welcome and valued. This attention to service enhances the overall dining experience.

Additionally, the decor of Bui Bistro beautifully reflects Vietnamese culture, creating a warm and inviting atmosphere. The thoughtful design elements and cozy seating make it an ideal spot for both casual meals and special occasions. Overall, Bui Bistro is a fantastic place to enjoy delicious Vietnamese food in a friendly and aesthetically pleasing environment!

reviews.text:
Me and my partner are always on the lookout for great dining experience and curated menus when we travel. It is very rare that we will find a restaurant that would have the food on point from start to finish. Normally we will find something that would be average for our tasts‚Ä¶but NOT CLOUD NINE SAIGON!!!

From the entree to the dessert and the mocktail shots - this restaurant delivered! The food is not the only thing to rave about. The ambience, lighting, and service were all 5-star!

Special thanks to Nguyen for attending to us, and we cannot praise the chef and their team in the kitchen for the outstanding dishes served to us!

Highly recommended and I would not be surprised if they end up in michelin guide in the future.

It is one of the best dining experiences! I reserved a very nice table with a nice view.  The food was delicious.  Anhle was my server, and he was very attentive and pleasant.  He loves his job, and it shows. The food presentation is exceptional.  I loved everything from the pepper grinder presentation to the baked Alaska dessert. I would visit again.

The only thing I didn't like was the music selection.  It was too dramatic and opera style. Not appropriatefor the setting. I want to relax and not be rushed,  not hear this bellowing music.  I did mention it because it was too much.  I think they either turned off a speaker or turned it down.  Later, the music selection changed.

Overall,  it was a great experience and delicious.

My colleagues and I spent the week in south Vietnam and decided to have a nice farewell dinner. We chose Cloud Nine and were so glad we did. The food was amazing, some of the best I have ever had. The presentation was equally as wonderful. The service of the staff was an A+ and the view of the city was great. I highly recommend this restaurant to anyone visiting HCMC.  Bravo!

I rate 2 stars because today's food was okay. The ribs were marinated in just the right amount of candied fish sauce as expected. But the staff attitude is VERY VERY BAD. Entering the shop, there was no employee to take orders. When I went to the counter to order, the staff ordered wrongly. There was also no apology to the customer. I ordered 1/3 of just egg rolls because as soon as I walked in, I saw the newspaper saying it was about to start baking. When ordering, I was told to wait 15 minutes. But after waiting for 10 minutes, the staff at the food counter called out to the waiter that they were out of pork belly and had to deal quickly so they could order to take away. That friend also came in and reported that the pork belly was out of stock while I had agreed to wait to eat that dish. When I didn't want to change it, I asked for the order again (even though I had already ordered pork belly and egg rolls) and then still served 1/3 portion as usual. From the moment I entered the restaurant, I did not understand the way the restaurant staff operated, but even if I made a mistake with the order or informed the customer of such a change, there was no apology or explanation. Even though there are only 3 tables in the restaurant, there are a total of 4 employees. When the rice is almost finished, the next dish is brought out. A very bad experience. In the picture is my plate. My brother's egg rolls came with me.

reviews.text:
B·∫øp Me In is on the Michelin Guide when I visited in Feb 2025. My own mark if a food is good, you have to try their local home styled cooking. Hence the pork stew, morning glory and the soup would give me an indication if the place is legit.
